class.name: ListDataEvent
class.javadoc:
Defines an event that encapsulates changes to a list.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeansTM has been added to the java.beans package. Please see {@link java.beans.XMLEncoder}. Hans Muller
Identifies one or more changes in the lists contents.
Identifies the addition of one or more contiguous items to the list
Identifies the removal of one or more contiguous items from the list

Returns the event type. The possible values are:
  • {@link #CONTENTS_CHANGED}
  • {@link #INTERVAL_ADDED}
  • {@link #INTERVAL_REMOVED}
an int representing the type value

Returns the lower index of the range. For a single element, this value is the same as that returned by {@link #getIndex1}.
an int representing the lower index value

Returns the upper index of the range. For a single element, this value is the same as that returned by {@link #getIndex0}.
an int representing the upper index value

Constructs a ListDataEvent object. If index0 is > index1, index0 and index1 will be swapped such that index0 will always be <= index1. source the source Object (typically this) type an int specifying {@link #CONTENTS_CHANGED},{@link #INTERVAL_ADDED}, or {@link #INTERVAL_REMOVED} index0 one end of the new interval index1 the other end of the new interval

Returns a string representation of this ListDataEvent. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null. 1.4 a string representation of this ListDataEvent.
